---
name: Pull Request
about: 'Create a pull request to contribute changes'

---

## Description
Please include a summary of changes and motivation behind them.

## Type of change
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Code refactoring (no functional changes, no API changes)
- [ ] Other (please describe):

## Related Issues
Fixes #<issue_number>
Related to #<issue_number>

## How Has This Been Tested?
Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes:
- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] Manual testing performed (describe steps)
- [ ] Tested on Python 3.8
- [ ] Tested on Python 3.9
- [ ] Tested on Python 3.10
- [ ] Tested on Python 3.11
- [ ] Tested on Python 3.12

## Checklist:
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG (if applicable) using towncrier

## Additional Notes
Add any other notes or context about the pull request here.

### Breaking Changes
If this PR introduces breaking changes, please describe them here:
- API changes that may break existing code
- Configuration changes
- Migration steps needed

### Performance Impact
If this PR affects performance, please describe:
- Benchmarks before
- Benchmarks after
- Performance improvements
